name: Kazy
description: A traditional Kazakh sausage made from horse meat and fat, seasoned with garlic and spices, and typically smoked or boiled.
steps: Prepare the intestines by thoroughly cleaning and then soaking in cold water.
Cut the horse meat and fat into strips, season with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Stuff the seasoned meat and fat tightly into the intestines.
Tie off the ends of the sausage and boil in water for an hour, or smoke for several hours until cooked through.
Serve sliced with traditional sides of bread and onions.
ingredients: 1 kg horse meat, preferably from the rib
tips: Ensuring the intestines are clean is crucial to avoid any unwanted flavors.
Do not overfill the casings to prevent bursting during cooking.
Kazy can be served hot or cold, and is often used in other dishes like beshbarmak.
